result.execSummary:
The defendant Charlie Phillips-Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to Dane County case Defendant is currently serving - 13CF2426

superMiscConds.notes:
*Pay Court costs
*Pay DNA surcharge
*25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

*Not to use or possess illicit drugs, alcohol or drug paraphernalia
*Have no contact with anyone associated with or actively using illegal drugs

*Pay DOC Supervision Fees
*Participate in any assessments or treatments deemed necessary to address mental health issues 
*Provide DNA sample if one has not already bee provided
*Participate in and successfully coplete an AODA assessment & comply with treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: of Sentencing Hearing on 07-29-16
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Charlie Phillips-Moore in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Charlie Phillips-Moore in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:35 PM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Court has a copy of the PSI which the Court has reviewed.
Both parties also received their copy.
Atty Kryshak has no corrections/additions to state for the record.

There is no reason why this Defendant should not be sentenced today.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court prior to sentencing, recommends 15-17 years prison.
State provides a restitution summary to the Court and a copy to Defense, may be joint and several.

Atty Kryshak addresses the Court prior to sentencing, recommends 10 years prison.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
Court questions Defendant as to programs Defendant is completing.

Court reviews the facts of the case. Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 11 years
Consecutive to Dane County case Defendant is currently serving, 13CF-2426
Initial Confinement for 4 years
Extended Supervision for 7 years
Not eligible for challenge incarceration program
Not eligible for substance abuse program
Conditions:
No to use or possession of illicit drugs, alcohol or drug paraphernalia
Have no contact with anyone associated with or actively using illegal drugs
Participate in and successfully complete an AODA assessment and treatment
Participate in any assessments or treatments deemed necessary to address mental health issues
Provide DNA sample if one has not already been provided
Pay court courts
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay DOC supervision fees
Pay restitution of $3,713.89 joint and several with Eric Olson
All to be taken out of prison account at rate of 25%

Appeal rights are addressed.

Defendant is remanded to the custody of the sheriff to be taken to Wisconsin Prison System.

Atty Kryshak addresses the Court regarding DNA Surcharge.  
Court advises to address Judge Shannon if need be regarding the surcharge.
Ad Prosequendum with attached Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum /s/ RJS 06/22/16

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on June 24, 2016 at 11:15 am.

1:30 p.m. Defendant Charlie Phillips-Moore in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Charlie Phillips-Moore in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Amended Information filed. Waived reading of amended information.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Parties will be requesting a PSI.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: amended count 1: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.


BY THE COURT: PSI report ordered, with copies to be provided to the parties when it is completed and submitted to the Court.

Court set sentencing date.
Bond is Revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing at 03-25-2016 09:30 am
Plea hearing at 01-22-2016 09:30 am
Jury trial - 12 person at 01-20-2016 08:30 am
Status conference at 06-29-2015 10:00 am
Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charlie Phillips-Moore in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Charlie Phillips-Moore in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:26 p.m.  Court calls the case.  

Det. J. Lawrynk is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Knaapen. 
Witness identifies the defendant. 
Cross exam by Atty Kryshak. 

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Atty Knaapen questions the Court re: this file being transferred to Br 3 since there is a case that is not necessarily a party to the crime co-defendant, but the same charge for the same victim.  
Court informs Atty Knaapen to ask Judge Flugaur. 
Atty Kryshak makes bond arguments to the Court. 
Atty Knaapen makes bond arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond modification is denied.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Atty Kryshak
Preliminary hearing on February 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
No contact with Erik Olsen. 
Advise the clerk of any change of address.

Defendant Charlie Phillips-Moore appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant indicates his sister is working on an attorney.  He is not in his office today.  

Court will continued to allow for the attorney to be present. 

Atty Cousins recommends a $100,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Defendant makes statements.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
